title: Sports briefs Monday
text:
(0) Comments GOLF 
University of Wisconsin junior Brooke Ferrell matched the second-lowest round in school history by firing a 6-under-par 66 in the Cardinal Cup on Monday in Louisville, Ky. 
Ferrell, who is from Edgerton, Wis., tied Jessie Gerry (2008), Isabel Alvarez (2007) and Malinda Johnson (2002). The best round ever recorded by a Badger came in 2013 when Kris Yoo shot a 65 at the NCAA Central Regional in Norman, Okla. 
Ferrell then registered a 2-over 74 in the second round to put her at a 4-under 140 through 36 holes. She had a two-stroke lead in the 54-hole tournament over Notre Dame's Isabella DiLisio . COLLEGE FOOTBALL 
Michigan State defensive back Jalen Watts-Jackson was released from a hospital in Ann Arbor, Mich., Monday, a day after he had surgery on a hip he injured while scoring the winning touchdown against Michigan. 
Watts-Jackson came up with a Michigan fumble on the final play of the game and returned it 38 yards to give the seventh-ranked Spartans an incredible 27-23 victory Saturday. The redshirt freshman appeared to land hard on his left hip while being tackled into the end zone by Michigan tight end Jake Butt. 
His surgery Sunday at the University of Michigan hospital lasted more than three hours. BASEBALL 
Detroit Tigers left-handed pitcher Daniel Norris is battling cancer. 
The 22-year-old, acquired from the Toronto Blue Jays near the July trade deadline in a deal for ace David Price , revealed the diagnosis on Instagram, saying he had known about the growth since his time with Toronto. 
Norris said he had the option to shut down his season following the diagnosis of a malignant tumor, but a doctor said he could finish the season before surgery and he chose that route. 
Norris went 3-2 with a 3.75 ERA this year in 13 starts for Toronto and Detroit. 
Zito retires: Left-handed pitcher Barry Zito , who spent his entire 15 years in the big leagues with Oakland and San Francisco, announced his retirement. 
The 37-year-old Zito, who won the 2002 AL Cy Young Award with the A's, went 165-143. SOCCER 
Carli Lloyd is among the 10 players on the shortlist for the 2015 Ballon D'Or award for the women's world player of the year after the American scored a hat trick in the World Cup final. 
Lloyd, whose club team is the Houston Dash of the NWSL, was one of three U.S. players on the list, the most of any country. She's joined by Seattle Reign teammates Hope Solo and Megan Rapinoe . 
Brazil's Marta , who won the award every year from 2006-'10, did not make the list. COLLEGE ATHLETICS 
UW-Milwaukee athletic director Amanda Braun was appointed to the NCAA's Division I Competition Oversight Committee. 
The committee has oversight of competitive matters for sports other than football and men's and women's basketball and oversees the NCAA Olympic Sports Liaison Committee. Along with supervision of the qualification and/or selection procedures for Division I and National Collegiate Championships, the committee will review recommendations from sports committees.
